line:
I hate making cover letters, so I made a program to make my cover letters. See my github page at https://github.com/sthgrau/CoverMe .

Here are some hightlights of my skills that match the job description:
I have used linux (Red Hat and Debian) for over 20 years, in both personal and professional contexts.
Automating things has always been a passion of mine, and I believe I show aptitude in abstraction and modeling in that capacity.
Shell scripting is the first tool I go to for a solution. It is the usually the fastest to implement and the easiest to read.
Perl was my goto text parser for many years.
Python has been my complex parser of choice for the past 5 years.
I have had a fair amount of experience maintaining and using databases such as Mysql and MS Sql Server for structured data.
Javascript is a very conventient language to know when dealing with rapid development interfaces. Knowing it has helped me get ideas out.
I have used git in professional and personal projects for least 5 years.
I have experience maintaining and operating Vmware servers, and some exposure to automating the installation.
I have recently had exposure to some node.js at work, then later for some personal projects.
I have some minor exposure to C# and .Net from previous work projects. It is conventient to be able to make apps for Windows clients.
I have recently been checking out Ansible, but haven't had a whole lot of experience.

Thanks for your time.
Stephen Grau
